articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Opens a Generational Opportunity for Chipmakers
articles.summary: The article discusses how the expansion of AI applications, especially large language models, is creating a "generational opportunity" for chipmakers. It highlights the projected growth of AI chip spending to nearly $165 billion by the end of the decade, primarily benefiting GPU-based chip providers like Nvidia, and notes that the demand for specialized AI hardware is leading to significant investments, partnerships, and a potential "long capital investment cycle" for the semiconductor industry. The article also examines how this shift will impact traditional CPU providers and accelerate the replacement of legacy computing infrastructure with AI-first hardware.

articles.title: The A.I. Race Is Now Between Two Chip Giants Led by Taiwanese American CEOs
articles.summary: The generative A.I. boom has intensified competition between semiconductor giants Nvidia and AMD, who are racing to produce advanced A.I. chips. AMD recently announced the MI300X, a direct competitor to Nvidia's H100, aiming to challenge Nvidia's dominant market share in the A.I. chip sector. Both companies are led by Taiwanese American CEOs, Jensen Huang of Nvidia and Lisa Su of AMD, who share similar backgrounds and have played pivotal roles in their companies' success in the semiconductor industry.

articles.title: A breakdown of AI ETFs as tech names burn bright
articles.summary: This article breaks down various AI-focused ETFs available in Europe, examining their methodologies, holdings, and performance. It highlights the differences in how these ETFs define and capture the AI theme, from market-cap weighted exposure to companies involved in big data and NLP to equally-weighted exposure based on AI-related revenue or IP. The piece also compares their costs, liquidity, and correlation of returns, noting that while some are dominated by large tech names, others offer differentiated exposure to companies leveraging machine learning.

articles.title: AMD launches new Instinct MI300X AI chip to take on Nvidia’s GPUs
articles.summary: AMD has launched its new Instinct MI300X AI accelerator chip, designed to compete with Nvidia's GPUs in the generative AI market. The company also introduced its Infinity Architecture Platform, powered by eight MI300X chips, and its ROCm software ecosystem. Despite these announcements, AMD's stock fell due to a lack of major customer endorsements for the new chips and details on pricing.

articles.title: AMD's AI chip challenge to Nvidia remains uphill fight with no big customers named
articles.summary: AMD unveiled new details about its MI300X artificial intelligence chip, designed to challenge Nvidia's market dominance, but did not announce any major customers for the product. While the chip offers significant memory capacity aimed at cost reduction for AI services, the lack of customer commitments disappointed Wall Street, causing AMD's stock to fall. Analysts noted that Nvidia's strong market position is reinforced by its software ecosystem, which AMD is attempting to counter with its Rocm platform.

articles.title: Comparing the Expense Ratios of ETFs Investing in AI: Which One Is Right for You?
articles.summary: This article compares the expense ratios and year-to-date returns of four ETFs that invest in artificial intelligence, focusing on options with lower fees. It discusses broad-based tech ETFs like FTEC, IETC, and IYW, and a new economies composite ETF, KOMP, highlighting their investment strategies and top holdings. The piece advises investors to consider expense ratios, YTD returns, investment goals, risk tolerance, and portfolio diversification when choosing an AI-focused ETF.

articles.title: Fidelity Disruptive Automation ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FBOT) $FBOT
articles.summary: This article provides an aggregate rating and price target for the Fidelity Disruptive Automation ETF (FBOT). Based on analyst ratings for its holdings, FBOT has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" with a consensus price target of $35.26. The report details the individual ratings and price targets for the top 12 holdings within the ETF, including companies like NVIDIA, Alphabet, and Amazon.

articles.title: AMD is chasing down Nvidia in AI, but one analyst worries the company is ‘somewhat late’
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) is pursuing the lucrative AI data-center market, estimated to be worth $150 billion, following recent product announcements. While many analysts praised AMD's efforts, Bernstein analyst Stacy Rasgon expressed concerns that AMD is "somewhat late" to the AI race compared to rival Nvidia Corp. Rasgon noted that AMD's AI discussion offered limited "hard numbers" and a timeline that seemed delayed relative to the competition.

articles.title: Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FDTX)
articles.summary: The Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX) is an actively managed exchange-traded fund that invests in innovative businesses with the potential for market disruption, including global disruptive technology companies in areas like machine learning and AI. The fund launched in April 2020 and is managed by Fidelity, with assets under management of $191.07 million. FDTX holdings include major tech companies such as NVIDIA, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, Microsoft, and Amazon.com.

articles.title: AMD launches new data-center AI chips, software to go up against Nvidia and Intel
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) unveiled new data-center AI chips and software, including the Instinct MI300X accelerator and MI300A, to compete with Nvidia Corp. and Intel Corp. Despite these announcements at its Data Center & AI Technology Premiere event, AMD's stock declined, finishing down 3.6%. The new products are specifically aimed at handling generative-AI workloads.

articles.title: Oracle founder Larry Ellison confirms new gen AI service with Cohere during earnings call
articles.summary: Oracle is partnering with Cohere to launch a new generative AI cloud service that will allow enterprises to train customized large language models (LLMs) using their private data while ensuring privacy and security. Oracle founder Larry Ellison announced the collaboration during the company's Q4 earnings call, highlighting Oracle's existing role in AI development and its significant investment in Cohere. This initiative expands Oracle's offerings in the rapidly growing generative AI market, where it competes with other major cloud providers.

articles.title: Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FDTX)
articles.summary: This article provides a review and aggregate rating for the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX). MarketBeat calculates this rating by considering the weighted sentiment of analyst ratings for the ETF's constituent stocks. FDTX currently holds a "Moderate Buy" aggregate rating with an average predicted price target reflecting its current share price, based on analyst coverage of 22 companies.

articles.title: iShares U.S. Tech Independence Focused ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (IETC)
articles.summary: This article provides a review and aggregate rating for the iShares U.S. Tech Independence Focused ETF (IETC). Based on analyst ratings of its holdings, the ETF has an aggregate "Moderate Buy" rating and a consensus price target of $100.66. The review details the top holdings within the ETF, their individual analyst ratings, and potential upsides.

articles.title: Active Growth ETF TGRW Doubling Returns of SPY
articles.summary: The T. Rowe Price Growth Stock ETF (TGRW) has demonstrated strong performance in the first half of 2023, doubling the year-to-date returns of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) with 32.1% compared to SPY's 15.8%. TGRW, which focuses on firms with strong cash flow and above-average earnings growth, is approaching its three-year anniversary and has seen substantial AUM growth. This active growth ETF is outperforming its benchmark thanks to its investment strategy and a competitive expense ratio of 52 basis points.

articles.title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FMET)
articles.summary: The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" with an average price target equal to its current share price of $36.66. The rating is based on 613 analyst ratings covering 20 companies (69.5% of the portfolio) over the past year. The ETF's top holdings include major tech companies like AMD, Alphabet, Apple, and NVIDIA.

articles.title: What will a Vodafone/Three merger mean for 5G in the UK?
articles.summary: A potential merger between Vodafone and Three in the UK is being considered a critical move to ensure their survival and competitive edge in the 5G market, which Three's boss has described as "unsustainable" with current investment spread across four players. The merger, valued at £15bn, would create the UK's largest mobile network operator, challenging existing consolidated players like BT/EE and Virgin Media/O2. However, it faces scrutiny from the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) due to concerns over market share and spectrum holdings, while the UK's 5G rollout continues amidst a ban on Huawei equipment and the increasing integration of AI in network infrastructure.

articles.title: TGRW Doubling Returns of SPY
articles.summary: The T. Rowe Price Growth Stock ETF (TGRW) has demonstrated strong performance in 2023, doubling the returns of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) year-to-date. TGRW's strategy of investing in growth firms with strong financial characteristics and a competitive expense ratio has contributed to its success, even as it approaches its three-year milestone. The ETF has also shown significant asset under management growth and strong technical indicators suggesting continued momentum.

articles.title: ETFs Head-to-Head: BetaShares RBTZ' vs Global X ROBO'
articles.summary: This article compares two ASX-listed ETFs focused on AI and robotics: BetaShares Global Robotics and Artificial Intelligence ETF (ASX: RBTZ) and Global X ROBO Global Robotics & Automation ETF (ASX: ROBO). It analyzes their fund objectives, profiles, holdings, performance, and fees, highlighting ROBO's greater diversification and historical outperformance despite higher management costs. The article concludes that while both offer exposure to AI and robotics, ROBO is larger and more diversified.
